structure.unit: Executive And Administrative Officers Of The Commonwealth
Department Of Elementary And Secondary Education

text.section: the increase in the percentage of students passing all three sections of the basic skills test;
the maintenance of at least a ninety-five per cent passing rate on all three sections of the basic skills test for no less than two successive years;
the number of students who previously failed any of the basic skills areas but who succeed in passing upon retesting in grades nine through twelve;
the increase, over the previous year, in the percentage of eligible school age children residing in the district and attending the public schools;
the decrease in the school’s or the district’s dropout rate;
the promotion of physical and emotional well-being and a positive school environment that fosters self-esteem;
the improvement of critical thinking and communication skills;
the recognition of the rights and responsibilities of citizenship in a democratic society;
the cultivation of shared values and mutual respect;
the appreciation of the arts and the encouragement of creative expression;
the understanding of history and the humanities;
the comprehension of mathematics, the sciences, and the uses of technology;
the mastery of foreign languages and interest in foreign cultures;
the development of occupational and vocational skills; and
the stimulation of desire for lifelong learning.
